Text.Value: Each pack of 'recruits' they bring in is worse than the last.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Belub is not impressed by the new pilgrims who have shown up to join the Absolutes cause.

Text.Value: Prisoners will come 'round eventually. Advisor Balthazar is damned persuasive.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.
EditorData.NodeContext: Hint of relish, bloodlust - by 'persuasive' he means 'very good at torture'

Text.Value: We'd be better off without 'em, take my word.
Its not our place to question the Absolute's will.
We just sent runners to the war camp, True Soul. This is bloody it.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.
EditorData.NodeContext: Barely contained excitment - can't wait to start marching
EditorData.logicalname: ARMY READY TO LEAVE, NOT MET

Text.Value: I'll see they get all the help they need, True Soul. And they'll need quite a bit...
The latest troupe didn't even make it past the door. Strong as gnome piss, the lot of 'em.
Can't trust them to sweep the stables, let alone swing a sword.
I've got the novices in hand, True Soul. War camps, docks... plenty of work for those who serve Her.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)
EditorData.NodeContext: Reassuring - we're not to worry, he's treating his subordinates like crap

Text.Value: I-  yeah. Yeah, they're dead weight. Not real believers like us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slowly coming around to an opinion

Text.Value: Even in the Underdark, some fools pray to Selûne's light. General will snuff it out soon enough.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.
EditorData.NodeContext: Reflecting on the power of the priestess they've captured - relishing the idea of his General breaking her

Text.Value: They have potential. Great warriors have grown from less.
No doubt - ain't for me to question them above me. I'm sure you know your business.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Bowing deeply with reverance, no hesitation.

Text.Value: Feel that warm glow? A priest of Selûne graces the tower. Sickening, isn't it?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.
EditorData.NodeContext: Sarcastic - oh what an honour it is for a priestess of a fancy god to come 'visit' them (she's being held against her will)

Text.Value: Aye, and better fighters than them've been fertiliser on the fields too.
I'll stick near you when the city walls come down, boss. I want to see how much damage you can do.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.

Text.Value: I hear the General's advisor is back. Which means we'll be hearing the screams of the prisoners again.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.
EditorData.NodeContext: Sighing - a little bored with the sounds of torture that come up from below the tower

Text.Value: Thank you, True Soul. In Her name!
I thought the Absolute welcomed all believers?
Then get rid of them. The undeserving should be purged.
We've all got our part in Her design. Just for some, that's mucking out latrines in the war camp.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)
EditorData.NodeContext: Amused - all these novices have come expecting a grand destiny, and he's assigning them menial tasks

Text.Value: Not for me to say. All I know is they're bloody useless 'round here.
Eh, beggin' your pardon, o' course. I'm sure you're mighty as they come.

EditorData.NodeContext: Belub realises he might've accidentally insulted the player, and the player's an important person in this place

Text.Value: And only She knows what part twits like them have to play in it.
O' course - wouldn't dare! I'm sure She's got a plan.

Synopsis: Standing at the entrance of Moonrise Tower, the guard is keeping eye on all the fresh blood seeking audience with the Absolute. The player can influence the guard to send the pilgrims to their death in Town, or to take a chance on them and send them as fodder to colony. Either way the pilgrims will have a bad time.
